author: pipermerriam
content:
<@456226577798135808> you mentioned that your trie implementation effectively unifies the account and contract storage tries.  Do you see this as something that could be extended to how we transmit witness/proof data?  Basically, shouldn't it be possible to create  a witness for any of:

- pure account data
- mix of account data and contract storage data
- pure contract storage data

this allows for us to just start treating the tries as if they are unified when transmitting proofs.

author: pipermerriam
content:
Another thing I haven't quite figured out is how to capture contract storage in the concept of key prefixes.  

- A prefix that is less than 32 bytes specifies some set of accounts.
- A prefix of exactly 32 bytes specifies exactly one account (and all of the storage)

Can we just extend it to allow up to 64 byte prefix so that the latter 32 bytes indicate paths into the contract's storage?
